Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state B,$P_{B}=0.6P_{0}$ and $V_{B}=V_{0}$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A,$P_{A}=P_{0}$ and $V_{A}=V_{0}$
According to the ideal gas equation of state $ rac{P_{A}V_{A}}{T_{A}}= rac{P_{B}V_{B}}{T_{B}}$, $T_{B}=0.6T_{0}$ can be obtained
